alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Chesterfield, southeastern Goochland, Caroline, Henrico, Hanover, northwestern King William and southeastern Powhatan Counties and the City of Richmond through 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ladysmith to Ashland to 6 miles east of Moseley. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Ashland, Bowling Green, Randolph Macon College, Virginia Commonwealth University, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Downtown Richmond, Bon Air, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Milford, Mechanicsville, Hanover, Port Royal, Manakin, Beulahville, Dawn, Sabot and Laurel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and east central Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, north central and east central Virginia.
